dialogues.text: I put a little cherry on top. You're right. What the hell he ever do for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now be careful with that bag. You don't want it ripping open on you in the middle of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the SOUND of Melanie leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie then transfers the half of a million dollars out of her flight bag into Melanie's Robinson's/May bag. She sticks her uniform in the flight bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then takes the towels and puts them on top of the money. She grabs her flight bag and leaves, leaving behind the Robinson's/May bag filled with half of a million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie, looking sharp in her new suit but acting a touch frantic and anxious, walks rapidly toward the sales counter where Amy waits for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just decided to stay in the suit - get out of that damn uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jackie and the salesgirl complete their transaction the CAMERA CIRCLES them, SLOWLY at first, but more RAPIDLY each go-around. They complete the transaction and as Jackie starts to leave, she stops and says to Amy;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, somebody left a shopping bag in there. Looks like beach towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jackie walks out of Robinson's/May hurriedly into the main mall. The calm, cool stride we're used to with Jackie is completely gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, looks around, head darting from one direction to another. She looks in a panic. The CAMERA begins to twirl around her. She seems to be looking for something she doesn't see. She looks helpless and on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the twirling CAMERA circles her, she screams;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray! Ray! I need you! Come out! She took the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicolet, Dargus, and two other plainclothes cops, come running out of a store towards Jackie. As they reach her, a frantic Jackie yells;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie burst in the dressing room and took the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis and Melanie pull up to a lined parking space in Melanie's Toyota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis is the first out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We STEDICAM in front of them, Louis the rapid pacesetter, pulling Melanie behind him by the hand. Melanie carries the Robinson's/May switch bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, get a grip, Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shoulda been there already and we woulda been if it hadn't been for your fuckin' around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We STEDICAM into Robison's/May with them. We lose them for a moment behind racks of dresses and mannequins, but end up landing on Jackie in her black suit, looking in a mirror and talking to Amy on the Designer Clothes floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You wear this to a business meeting, you're the badass in the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN away and find Louis and Melanie by a dress rack, watching Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice outfit on her. I'm gonna go over and look at this Michi Moon display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay right fuckin' here, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis' hand immediately goes to his forehead and touches dampness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job a little too much for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis shoots Melanie a hard convict look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie smiles at him, feeling the stare, but too much of a natural-born smart ass to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be over here. You're too conspicuous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis looks over at the fitting room. Jackie is going inside it, and the saleswoman is walking away towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches the saleswoman walk by him, then looks back in time to see Melanie enter the fitting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, not till I tell ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He decides he's watching the fitting room entrance too much, so he starts throwing his look around when he sees something that stops him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is looking at dresses, paying no attention to the fitting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks, 'what the fuck is Max Cherry doing here?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, doing what he's doing, looks up and sees Louis staring at him across the floor. Max smiles and gives Louis a wave before turning his back to him and continues to do what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly looks around the store to see anything else; any more surprise guests, possible police surveillance. Everything looks normal. The saleswoman is behind the register ringing up Jackie's purchase. The few customers there are doing customer stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he sees Melanie come out with a Robinson's/May bag and head down a different aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries down his aisle and cuts her off. Their whole fight is said tense and low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting out of here. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I can carry it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to push past him, and he catches her by her arm and pulls her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, dipshit. You wanna rip the fuckin' bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that bag before I knock you out and take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie realizes Louis ain't fuckin' kiddin'. Not only that, this old guy looks close to buggin'. She lets go of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Take it. Jesus, what's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes it. They start walking. We STEDICAM in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you got it. Just take a chill pill, for christ sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis has had enough of her slang and says tensely through gritted teeth;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you with your chill pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stops dead. He looks around, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELANIE (CONT'D) (like a teacher on Romper Room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo, that's towards Sears. We came in through Bullocks. I know where it is. Want to follow me, Lou-is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed, he leaves FRAME. Melanie, wearing her Melanie smirk, follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis, clutching the shopping bag close to his chest, walks rapidly down an aisle of parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We STEDICAM alongside. We walk for awhile, Louis changes direction to another aisle. WE'RE NOW IN FRONT of him. We see he has a searching look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea where you parked, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, but if you two aren't the biggest fuck-ups I've ever seen in my life... How did you ever rob a bank? When you robbed banks, did you have to look for your car then too? No wonder you went to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis could kill her right now. Just take his gun out of his pants and shoot her in her snickering face. But instead of doing what he wants, he does what he should. He doesn't answer of look back. (If he looked back and saw that Melanie-smirk, he couldn't e responsible for what happens.)He changes directions, cuts down another aisle and hopes for both their sakes she shuts the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But our Melanie just keeps on being Melanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk it; it's not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis changes direction and cuts between some cars to the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it this aisle or the next one over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In between two cars, Louis spins on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything else, okay? I'm telling you, keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie was surprised by the spin, but is about to say something anyway when Louis put his hand up and says;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it. Don't say one fuckin' word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis whips out the Beretta Ordell gave him, shoots her... BAM... in the belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bounces OFF one of the cars and goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM... Louis shoots her again on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One; to make sure. Two; cause it felt good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he hurries of for his car. WE FOLLOW IN FRONT OF HIM. He looks around, then yells out;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, just where I fuckin' said it was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hops in the car, and throws it into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can se Melanie's bare legs sticking out from a row of cars. Louis stops the Toyota alongside the dead Melanie, and yells through the passenger window;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Cherry's Cadillac Seville pulls up to a lined space in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets out of his car and casually strolls towards the Del Amo Mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, hands in pocket, strolls unhurriedly through the Robinson's/May store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks around the store, keeping one eye peeled toward the Designer Clothes section. He walks up to a jewelry counter and begins looking at he pieces in the display case, when a pretty, young SALESGIRL comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now. I'm just killing time waiting for my wife. But thanks, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. If anything grabs you, don't be shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks towards Designer Clothes and sees Jackie walking out of the fitting room wearing the cool black suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. You look so cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie moves over to the mirror and checks herself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks back to the jewelry display case, saying under his breath;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie looks at her reflection in the mirror. Then she lifts her eyes, meeting Max's across the room. Max gives her a nod of his head to show he approves. Jackie smiles and breaks contact, turning to Amy. We hear her say from a distance. "This looks pretty good on me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hears a commotion behind him and turns to see Louis and Melanie hurriedly making their way towards Designer Clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his attention back to browsing through dresses on a rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Louis and Melanie squabbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Jackie disappear into the fitting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Amy leaving the fitting room entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Melanie, by herself, watch Amy leave. Melanie watches the fitting room for a few moments. Gathering her courage, then makes her move, entering the fitting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max smiles to himself, "so far so good" he thinks. He throws a look towards Louis, only to see Louis staring dead at him with an unhappy look on his face. Max returns the look with a smile and a wave then turns his back on his before he can see a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Melanie come out of the fitting room carrying a Robinson's/May bag close to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Jackie come out of the fitting room, go over to Amy and buy the dress. Jackie goes into her act, acting agitated and distracted as she talks to Amy, pays with cash, then leaves stopping to say;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, somebody left a shopping bag in there. Looks like beach towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy is left alone by the cashier counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max looks at Amy, then at the fitting room entrance, he says to himself;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, old boy. You've spent nineteen years dealing with people who take incredible risks. You walk over to that counter, you're gonna find out what it's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but my wife thinks she left a bag of beach towels in the fitting room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think they're back there. Go get 'em. There's nobody in there. I think they're in the last stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max walks toward the fitting room, enters it, walks down the length of stalls, and stops in front of the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door to the stall. Sitting in the corner is the Robinson's/May bag. He walks over to it, lifts out the towels, and sees all that money. He replaces the towels, picks up the bag and leaves. HE walks across the Designer Clothes, passes by Amy, says;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max walks unhurriedly toward the door that leads to the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's outside; nobody's stopped him. He keeps walking towards his blue Seville. He keeps walking unhurriedly, never looking back. He gets to his car, uses opening the car door as an excuse to look back at the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's normal. Nobody's after him, nobody's watching him. He made it. It worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max allows himself a smile, gets into his Cadillac with his half-a-million bucks and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell sits at the bar in Sam's drinking a screwdriver and watching a stripper strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stressed Louis drives the Toyota, calling Ordell on Ordell's tiny cellular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. Listen, there's something else I have to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I see you. Pick me up at Sam's. You count the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't even looked at it yet, it's still in the shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie must be dyin' to see it. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I got to talk to you about. You see, Melanie was giving me a hard time -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toyota pulls up to the back of the bar. Ordell hops in, the car takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oredell in the passenger seat, bends over to the backseat, grabs the shopping bag, and brings it to his lap. He looks like a kid at Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep drivin' down Ninth, to where they got all them car dealerships. We're gonna leave this heap in a parking lot and get one the cops don't know about. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I gotta tell you. She bugged me the whole time. Got pissy with me 'cause I wouldn't let her carry the bag. Started running her fuckin' mouth... I couldn't remember right away when we came out where the car was parked, so she got on me about that. "Is it this aisle Lou-is, is it that one?" She was totally fuckin' with my nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, you left her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell still doesn't say anything... then says;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... but at that moment... I dunno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you had to do it, you had to do it. What we don't want is that bitch surviving on us. Anybody but that woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell shrugs it off, and digs into the shopping bag. He pulls out the towels and sees forty-thousand dollars on top of a bunch of paperbacks. His stomach drops. He just looks inside the bag for the longest time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis drives, oblivious to Ordell's dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe forty, maybe not that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said five hundred and fifty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you light, ain't you. You light about a half-a-million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, that's the bag she came out with. She never even put her hand in it, and neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fitting room. It went down exactly the way it was supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was she in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a minute. She came right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis, You tellin' me the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I swear to fucking god, she came out with that bag and I took it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went to the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure she ain't somewhere with a half-a-million dollars I worked my ass off to earn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you for asking me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis pulls it over, and stops on Ninth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell opens the glove box and takes out the Beretta. He smells the end of the barrel. He releases the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that gonna tell you" If I was really pullin' a burn, I'd have taken two out, wouldn't I? I thought you trusted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell looks at him. Louis didn't burn him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a bunch of money, looking into the camera, and saying with a smile;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie's gonna die. He slaps the magazine back into the Beretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so it was Jackie Brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's got it, why didn't she take it all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'fore I blow that bitch's brains out, I'll ask her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there were nothin; in here but towels, maybe she didn't get a chance to take it from her suitcase and A.T.F. got it. But, she put these fuckin' books in here to trick our ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I never checked it. The bag felt right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she throws forty thousand in here, to rub the shit in my face, know what I'm saying? She wants me to know she ripped me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Either she has it or the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... she gave it to somebody else first, before Melanie went in the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets real quiet in the car, as Louis remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I saw in the dress department?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't really think anything of it. No - I did wonder what he was doing there, but didn't think it had anything to do with us. You know like maybe he was there with his wife or girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me who it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell has to look away from Louis, takes a beat, then looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see Max Cherry in the dress department. We're about to be handed half-a-million dollars - Man, look at me when I'm talking to you! And you don't think nothing of him being there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do Max Cherry and Jackie Brown know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yes, they know each other. He bonded her out of county.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the motherfucker's a bail bondsman, don't ya? You know every last one of them motherfuckers is crooked as hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I think anything's weird, if I don't know nothin' about them knowing each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I don't want to hear your fuckin' excuses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't givin' you fuckin' excuses, I'm givin' you reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you gonna tell me the reason you lost all the goddam money I got in the world! Let me tell you the reason, motherfucker! The reason is, your ass ain't worth a shit no more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis turns into the hard convict on the yard, and tells Ordell;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis falls back against the car door, eyes wide open, staring at Ordell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell takes the pistol, works the barrel up higher on Louis' side, right under him arm, and shoots him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time Louis' head BANGS against the car door window. He slumps over - his life gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to you, man? Shit, your ass use'ta be beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell takes the bag and gets out of the car, leaving Louis' dead body there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you were gonna do some shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie, still dressed in her cool black suit, sits in a chair in Nicolet's office. Davidoff between the fingers of one hand, she holds a small, white styrofoam cup of coffee in he other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't. I would think with all this on your mind, you'd wait till after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got there early. I've had my eye on this suit - Wait, let's start over. I got there early. The idea was to try on the suit, see if I liked it. If I did, get them to wrap it up, and change back into my uniform. That's what Sheronda's expecting me to wear. Go meet Sheronda, give her the bag with fifty thousand, and go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I didn't have it. Ray, I swear, Melanie came in and grabbed it. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And someone killed her for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicolet looks at Jackie for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the bag she gave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't give me one. I told you before, Melanie wasn't part of the plan. Ordell must of told her to do it. She bursts in, grabs the shopping bag, and takes off. What am I supposed to do, go after her? I'm in my fucking underwear. I had to get dressed before I could do anything. So I put this back on 'cause could put this on faster than I could my uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took the time to pay the saleswoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to. I was frantic. I didn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went looking for you. I went straight to the bookstore, 'cause that's where you were last time, but you weren't there. How the hell else am I supposed to let anybody know what happened? You didn't tell me how to do that, did you? I knew I was under surveillance, so when I couldn't spot anybody, I started yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a guy with Melanie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretends to shop. She watches Louis grab Melanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had our agent on you. She sees a blonde come out of the fitting room carrying a Robinson's/May bag and tussle with a tough-looking white guy. The white guy takes the shopping bag and they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy with Melanie, that was Louis Gara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see him. I was in my underwear. If it was a white guy, it was probably Louis. He kill Melanie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible. You're saying you don't have any idea what happened to that fifty thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd take a polygraph on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope you haven't done anything dumb Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both leave, leaving Jackie all by herself in the room, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicolet continues, Dargus takes a seat in the corner saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis Gara's dead. L.A.P.D. found him dead in a car on Ninth. And we've lost Ordell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were, and we lost him. He walked into a strip bar sometime around three thirty and never came out. The bar was on Ninth, less than a mile- and-a-half from where Louis was found dead. It looks like Louis's friend shot him twice at point blank range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up Ordell. We've got three murders we can link him to. We have the storage unit where he keeps his guns, by tomorrow we'll have a search warrant to go in and get him. And we have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I took some of that money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no evidence of your taking anything. You didn't pay for your snazzy new suit with marked bills; I was glad to see that. You've been helping us out, you gave us Melanie and Louis. Melanie had a packet of marked bills stuffed in her shorts when they found her, which goes a long way backing up your story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll settle for Ordell with the marked bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have something else going on you haven't told me about, it's between you and Ordell. All I gotta say is, you better hope we find him before he finds you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I can't leave here today... Mr. Walker, I ain't goin' nowhere till I get my money... You wouldn't have that fuckin' boat weren't for me. Man, I'm learnin' real fast who my friends are... Mr. Walker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell turn to a glassy-eyed black female junkie nodding on the couch named RAYNELLE. The filthy apartment we're in belongs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe that shit? Motherfucker hung up on me. Ingrate nigger. Do things for people and that's how they treat you. Goddamn girl, how can you live like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me speak to Max Cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston behind his desk, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Def Comedy Jam plays on TV, a black comedian does a nasty stand-up routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell and Raynelle sit on the couch watching Def Comedy Jam; neither one is laughing. Raynelle's too stoned. Ordell's too tense. The phone rings, he jumps on it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max on the other end behind his desk. Winston sitting on the edge of the desk listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell's up and off the couch pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Robbie, isn't it? I have the ten thousand you put up. Isn't that why you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bond collateral on Beaumont Livingston you moved over to cover Miss Brown, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They decided to no-file. Tell me where you are and I'll bring you your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looky here, I know you helped her and I know you know what I want Jackie can tell me any story come in that pretty head of hers. Long as at the end of that story, she hands over my money. She do that, we're still friends. Now, she don't wanna be my friend no more, tell her to think about ol' Louis. And if she tries to turn me in, I'll name her ass as my accessory. We'll go upstate together. Hand in handcuffed hand. Now that shit's a promise, understand what I'm sayin'? You tell her that, and I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell hangs up. Back in control. He looks to the TV. One of the COMEDIANS cracks a joke. Ordell laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, that was Ordell. You have time, you think you could find out for me where he's staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have your winning personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. I don't have to know what I'm doing, long as you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I do. Is that good enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low-rent motel. We hear a phone ring inside one of the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie lies on a hotel bed, wearing a long t-shirt and panties, watching TV that's chained to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max on the phone in his office, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets her attention. She picks up the remote to the TV set and zaps the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Winston had to do was ask around. Ordell's living in Long Beach with a woman junkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does Winston find him if A.T.F. and all the local Police can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People talk to Winston. He's street, same as them, they trust him. They get busted, they know somebody who can bond them out. I thought I might drop in on him. He'll no doubt be surprised to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone I told him I have the ten thousand he put up for your bond. I could bring the money and the papers for him to sign. Walk out and call the Sheriff's department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wants him, he's a homicide suspect. It doesn't matter who brings him in, he's gonna name you as an accessory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why A.T.F.'s gotta make the case. I'm their witness. They wouldn't have a case without me. If it's his word against mine, who are they gonna believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone in one hand, smoke in the other, Jackie begins pacing back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never was, so I'm not gonna start worrying about it now. Look, Ray more or less believes my story, and he more or less doesn't care. All he really gives a shit about is getting Ordell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do we give Ordell to Nicolet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Ordell to come to your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him you want to see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I want to give him his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've chickened out. I'm afraid of him. He'll like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell called and wants to meet me and I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get Ordell to come to my office. Nicolet - is he already there, or does he come busting in while we're chatting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he hears something he's not supposed to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we don't let that happen, now do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max at the front door or Raynelle's apartment. He pounds on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doin' knockin on the door like the goddamn police? You lookin' to get shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might be asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep fuckin' with me, you're gonna be asleep forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters, Ordell slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ordell turns away from the door, Maxis reaching into his coat. Ordell brings his Beretta up at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max freezes, his hand in his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your money? Your bond refund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his hand out, it's holding stack of bills wrapped in a rubber band. He tosses it to Ordell, who catches it with his free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a bond receipt for you to sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the fuck I'm talkin' about. You talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to give you your money. If she didn't, there'd be cops batter- ramming the door right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck did he find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Winston does. He finds people who don't want to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, bully for that nigga. You say she wants to give me the money, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, give it to me then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to give it to you herself and collect her ten percent. She also wants to explain why she had to hold on to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear that too. Turn around and put your hands on your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max does this, Ordell pats him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie didn't trust Melanie. She'd already tried to get Jackie to go in with her, split the half million amongst themselves. What she did was take quite a risk to see you get your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift up your pant leg. You help her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I did was walk out with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you did that to protect my interest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass be dumb, but I'm not a dumbass. Go sit over there on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get used to it after a while. Now tell me where my money's at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been there since Thursday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted to see me, why wasn't she home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still is. She doesn't want to get shot before she can tell you what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have her bring the money here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the safe. She can't get at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call her, tell her the combination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, you got her spooked. She won't leave there till you have your money and you're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to just walk in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she wanted to set you up, you'd be in custody right now. When you said you'd name her as an accessory she believed you. That scares her more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why she's givin' up my money huh? Not that bullshit about Melanie. I didn't trust her ass neither, but I knew how to handle her. She was my blonde-headed little surfer gal. I fuckin' told Louis he could've just given her a punch in the mouth, he didn't need to shoot her. She's at your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By herself. That big mandingo nigga Winston ain't there, is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call your office, she better answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie on the phone with Ordell, sitting behind Max's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be here. Se ya' in a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone. Then starts dialing again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEDICAM glides through the apartment, it falls on a beeper "beeping", a gun, a wallet and car keys on a dresser drawer... it leaves that and lands on a TV screen: Tom Snyder is interviewing a guest on his show ... it leaves that and falls on two empty and one quarter filled beer bottles... it leaves that and falls on a sleeping Ray Nicolet passed out in his reclining chair. The sound of Tom Snyder and the faint beeping are heard offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave the apartment walking to Max's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time I've known her, I never heard her sound scared like that. Ordinarily she's too cool for school. I'm driving, gimme the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hands him the keys. They climb in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie sitting behind the desk. She opens the drawer to her right, Max's .38 sits there. She closes the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell behind the wheel, Max the passenger. Ordell plays the radio, he likes the song and turns it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting alone in the office, she gets up and turns off the lights. The office goes dark. No music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song plays LOUD. Ordell moves his head to the music slightly. Mak sits silently in the passenger seat, sneaking a look at Ordell every once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting behind Max's desk in the dark. She takes out her Davidoffs and lights one up with her Bic. Her face is illuminated for a moment - then it's out. She exhales a drag. No music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face is ice, the music is LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cool as a breeze, smoking her brand. No music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music is LOUD. Ordell's driving. Max says;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting behind Max's desk. Headlights shine in the window. She is lit by them. She puts out her Davidoff and sits back in the chair. The light source cuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the parked Cadillac. Ordell has just turned off the lights and turns to Max, Beretta in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My money's in that office, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts givin' me some bullshit about it ain't there. It's somewhere else and we can go get it. (he holds up his Beretta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm shootin' you in the head right then and there. Then I'm gonna shoot her in the kneecap, find out where my godamn money is. I go walkin' in there and that nigga Winston or anybody else is in there, you're the first man shot, understand what I'm sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, is there anything you want to tell me before we get out of this car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get out of the Cadillac. Ordell sticks his gun in his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ahead of me and open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max steps in front of him, puts his keys in the lock and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sees; Jackie sitting at his desk in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordell sees this, too and moves past Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, girl, what the hell you sitting in the goddamn dark for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sees; Ordell moves past him... then he sees the bathroom door on the left side of the desk open, throwing light into the room, onto Jackie and the figure who steps out of the bathroom... Mark Dargus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sees; Ordell looks to Dargus, then back to Jackie. Then Jackie says;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sees; Ordell almost jumps, his arm goes to the Beretta in his pants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just as Dargus raises his gun and SHOOTS him three times in the chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ordell drops o the ground like a sack of potatoes, he lands at Max's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks down and sees Ordell's head by his shoes, look of panic still on his face, dead as fried chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sees Dargus come over, bending on one nee next to Ordell's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks over at Jackie, still behind the desk. She looks eyes with Max for a moment, then stands and walks over to the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Max sees ONE SHERIFF DEPUTY step out of the dark holding a shogun ... then another... then Winston step out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have the marked bills on him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dargus reaches in and pulls out the envelope containing the forty-thousand marked dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down at the dead Ordell with no expression, just light up another Davidoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to give him his refund, so he wouldn't have to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know where he was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't tell the Police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Jackie, and Jackie said you wanted him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dargus looks down at he man he just killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when Ray said you hoped you'd get him before he got me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dargus looks up and nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a drag on her Davidoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As opposed to the last scene late at night, it's early morning. Max sits at his desk, filling out a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks up and sees Jackie Brown, standing in the doorway. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX FLASHES ON Jackie behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your package. It was fun getting a half-a-million dollars in the mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, your fee. I had to figure that out, since there wasn't no note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits in the chair in front of his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only this isn't a bail bond, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worked for it - if you're sure that's all you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving, I have my things in my car. Why don't you walk out with me? I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Max. I won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and gets up from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Ray the other day. Boy is he pissed he missed all the excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on to a new thing. He's after a guy who owns a gun shop he says is "woefully and wantonly" selling assault rifles to minors. He says he's gonna take him down if it's the last thing he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him you were leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk outside and Max sees Ordell's black Mercedes convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've confiscated all his other stuff. But this one's sorta left over. The registration's in the glove box, the keys were under the seat... What's a matter" haven't you ever borrowed someone's car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around to the other side of the car, and looks at him across the black Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fifty-five-years old. I can't blame anybody for anything I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you blame yourself for helping me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'd feel a whole lot better if you took some more money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start off in Madrid. Ever been there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear they don't eat dinner till midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but you have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I can't twist your arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for saying that, but no. My business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were tired of your business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max smiles and holds up two fingers, close to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give each other a long, tender kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send you a postcard, partner.
